snippet: After allowing five runs in Game 1, Orioles closer Jim Johnson got three quick outs in Game 2, leaving the Yankees’ Robinson Cano in the on-deck circle.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Baseball column notes that after allowing five runs in Game 1 of the American League division series against New York Yankees, Baltimore Orioles closer Jim Johnson recorded three quick outs in Game 2, leaving New York Yankees slugger Robinson Cano in the on-deck circle.
lead_paragraph: After allowing five runs in Game 1, Orioles closer Jim Johnson got three quick outs in Game 2, leaving the Yankees’ Robinson Cano in the on-deck circle.

headline.seo: A.L. Division Series — Orioles Closer Jim Johnson Finds Redemption
headline.main: Closer Finds Redemption in a 1-2-3 Ninth
headline.print_headline: Closer Finds Redemption in a 1-2-3 Ninth
